There is still negligible friction between block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and the table. A lump of clay is added to block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The students use Newton’s second law to derive an equation for the acceleration <math alttext="a sub C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of block <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The acceleration is given by the equation <math alttext="a sub C equals, the fraction with numerator m sub C, end subscript, times g, and denominator m sub total, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>tot</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="m sub total" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>tot</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is the combined mass of the clay and the two blocks. Students use the setup shown above to experimentally determine the acceleration <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> due to gravity. In each trial, a student moves a small amount of clay from block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to block <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and then releases the blocks from rest, recording the new values of <math alttext="m sub C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="a sub C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Use the best-fit line from part (c)(i) to calculate an experimental value for the acceleration <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> due to gravity.
